newsitem.title: CHINA: U.N. to give China $1.89 million to fight AIDS.
newsitem.headline: U.N. to give China $1.89 million to fight AIDS.

text.p: The United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) has pledged to give China $1.89 million to battle AIDS over the next four years, the Xinhua news agency said on Tuesday.
The grant would assist the central government and the provincial governments of Fujian, Guangdong and Hainan in southern China to prevent and control HIV transmission, the news agency said.
HIV, or Human Immunodeficiency Virus, can lead to AIDS, or Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome.
UNDP gave China $1.1 million in the past 3-1/2 years to minimise HIV transmission.

The number of reported HIV cases in China stood at 5,157 at the end of October last year, but officials say the real figure could be closer to 100,000 -- a number independent experts say is itself conservative.
A total of 133 people have been infected with AIDS in China, according to the official media.
China has been grappling with growing drug abuse and prostitution, and experts warn these two problems could increase the number of AIDS cases.
